structures.tree
Class BinaryTree<T>

java.lang.Object
  structures.tree.BinaryTree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of objects stored in this tree.
public class BinaryTree<T>
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a low-level binary tree structure that can be accessed and manipulated via its nodes and its links. The structure is represented in a recursive fashion, i.e. an instance of this class is really a node object that is the root of a binary tree.

Author:
Sesh Venugopal

makeRoot

public void makeRoot(T data)
Makes the root node of this binary tree.

Parameters:
data - Data to be stored at this root node.
Throws:
TreeViolationException - If there is already a root node.

attachLeft

public void attachLeft(BinaryTree<T> tree)
Attaches given tree (root node of tree) as the left child of this node.

Parameters:
tree - Tree (root node) to be attached.
Throws:
TreeViolationException - If this node already has a left child.

Attaches given tree (root node of tree) as the right child of this node.

Parameters:

Throws:
TreeViolationException - If this node already has a right child.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Tells whether this tree is empty or not.

Returns:
True if this is tree is empty, false otherwise.

clear

public void clear()
Empties this tree by removing all nodes including root. To start over, the makeRoot method must be called.

root

public BinaryTree<T> root()
Returns the root of the tree that contains this node.

Returns:
Root of the tree.
